comments.comment: I have a bad experience in government hospital too still remember the incident which  is happened on 2008  in the general hospital Colombo I was schooling that time 20 minutes before the bells ring to finishes school I broke my arm wile we playing in the college ground. Luckily one of the rugby coaches where there in that time came to me and took one handkerchief from his pocket and asked for a another one from a friend of mine  he kept one under my arm to hold it with a L shape he took the other one and put around my neck and tight to hang my broken arm so time is running school finishes not only our school all the schools which is on gall road and they take me to the hospital with this big rush finally we reach to the accident ward and they admitted me but no one came to chek Except the doctor from the OPD who admitted me. my arm have got really swollen but no one bothered to give a painkiller even. They said I have to go through a surgery for that they have to wait until my parents come to sign the papers. my  coach tried to explain that we came from the school even they can see that I am wearing the school uniform so he said that he already call to my parents and there on the way and then nurse answered ‚Äú oya lamayage demawpiyo neme apita oya kiyana widiyata treater danna baha amma Hari thatta Hari enkan apita ape wada karanna dila tikak idagena inna methana inna eka ledek neme ‚Äú after like 2 hrs my father reached the hospital and ask from the nurse about my situation and she asked my father to have a seat and wait until she call we waited and waited it‚Äôs been 4 hrs already since I broke my arm but they didn‚Äôt give a shit finally my father went to the nurse to ask again and he stated argue with that nurse it was a small argument that nurse raises the voice more than my father that time but finally something happened which we never expected one of the police man who was on duty in the general hospital came to us and ask my father to come with him to give a Statement actually that nurse have complained to the police that my father abused her verbally my father try to approach them but they asked him to come just for five minutes . after given the statement finally we decided to go for a another hospital because we felt like they are taking the revenge by not giving a shit so my father hold my other hand and start walking outside from the ward one nurse asked from my father where is he taking me and he replayed that we are going to another hospital suddenly other nurse the one who complained to the police she came and told to my father that he cannot take me out since I am admitted already. my father doesn‚Äôt wanna listen to them anymore since they didn‚Äôt do anything for my arm so he just walk thorough the corridor pretend like we don‚Äôt hear what the says. she raise her voice and say she have to complained to the police if he takes me outside because it‚Äôs not allowed until they checked me out we just went out straight a way drive to the asha central hospital which is closer to general hospital we went in the opd and they send me to get the x rays of my arm waited for couple of minutes and doctor ask my father to take me in the accident ward because it‚Äôs a serious fracture I really don‚Äôt wanna go back to that he‚Äôll so I asked my father to speak with the doctor to do the surgery in Asha hospital and he explained the situation to my father he said to get the best results we should go in the accident ward also from the legal side. so we came back in the general hospital but they have already complained about me as a missing patient again we went through the OPD with the XRay that we got from asha hospital the doctor who checked me for the second time  informed them to take me in the treater room as soon as I admitted it‚Äôs been 7 hrs passed since I broke my arm finally they took me for the surgery  so my point is if your not a person who cares about humanity if your not a person who can‚Äôt feel others pain if your not a person who can control patience please don‚Äôt choose to be a nurse

comments.comment:
Mrs. Mangalika, I started following you after you received the Derana sri Lankan of the year award. The humanitarian services you are providing to the rest of HIV affected women is highly commendable. It is very unfortunate how uneducated the sri Lankan population is on HIV.  Very sad situation. It's very different in the developed countries. 

I cried listening to your story. Sri Lanka boasts of buddhism, 2500 year old culture, pirith during every poya day, multiculturalism etc. Look how your husband was treated even after death. That's in humane.  üò¢

You are a inspiration to the rest of womanhood. You are a iron lady.   Please keep your head high and continue to do what you are doing. More power and strength to you!!
comments.author: asha. ranatunga

replies.replyComment: Lakave minissu dakshai manussainva nomara maranna.

Lankave minussunge modakama gana kiyala vadak naha. Mama hiv minissunva athin alla saaththu karala thiyenava. Thava api athra kidenekge ange thiyenavada danne kohomada. 
Pirith dana gana duk venna epa. Eva sanskruthika deval. Ohu karagaththu deval ohuta labei. 
Prethikara hatiyata, kohomba kola isma bonna. Ehema barinam tablet aragena bonna. Sugar, piti jathi ahara , animal protein, ela kiri ahara kana eka nathara karanna. Eva thamai ea virus eka jeevath karavanne. Manasikava vatenna epa. Me vidiyata prethikara karala lamai dennage manasike godanaganna. Theruvan saranai.
Dukai... duuupath  minissu  ohomai.. dirimath  wenna.....
